alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 08 at 8:43PM PDT until August 08 at 11:15PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN IMPERIAL COUNTY... At 843 PM PDT, Rainfall between 1 and 3 inches has fallen in the last few hours over the southwest quarter of Imperial County. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of normally dry washes, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... El Centro, Brawley, Imperial, Plaster City, Ocotillo, Westmorland, Mountain Spring, Seeley, Coyote Wells, and Heber. This includes the following streams and drainages... Carrizo Wash, Boulder Creek, Alamo River, Tarantula Wash, Fish Creek Wash, New River, Myer Creek, Palm Canyon Wash, Gert Wash, Salt Creek Slough and San Felipe Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. It is especially difficult to determine water depth at night.
